meico.audio

Class Audio

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.audio.Audio

  • public class Audio
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents audio data.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Audio()
      constructor, generates empty instance
      Audio(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream inputStream)
      constructor with AudioInputStream
      Audio(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream inputStream, java.io.File file)
      this constructor reads audio data from the AudioInputStream and associates the file with it; the file may differ from the input stream
      Audio(byte[] audioData, javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat format, java.io.File file)
      with this constructor all data is given explicitly
      Audio(java.io.File file)
      constructor; use this one to load and decode MP3 files

      boolean writeMp3(java.lang.String filename)
      write audio data as MP3 to the file system with specified filename, this will generate an mp3 file even if you give it another extension

      • convertByteArray2DoubleArray

        public static java.util.ArrayList<double[]> convertByteArray2DoubleArray(byte[] array,
                                                                         javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat format)
        This can be used to convert the byte array of an Audio object into an array of doubles between -1.0 and 1.0 which is far more convenient for audio analyses.
        Parameters:
        array -
        format -
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of double arrays, each is an audio channel (stereo sequence is [left, right])

      • convertDoubleArray2ByteArray

        public static byte[] convertDoubleArray2ByteArray(double[] array,
                                                  int sampleSizeInBits)
        This method converts an input double array into a byte array.
        Parameters:
        array -
        sampleSizeInBits - this will mostly be 16; the value can be retrieved from an Audio object via audio.getFormat().getSampleSizeInBits()
        Returns:

      • exportWaveformImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage exportWaveformImage(int width,
                                                        int height)
        Make a waveform image from the audio data.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the image in pixels
        height - the height of the image in pixels
        Returns:
        a BufferedImage instance

      • convertWaveform2Image

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage convertWaveform2Image(double[] audio,
                                                                 int leftmostSample,
                                                                 int rightmostSample,
                                                                 int width,
                                                                 int height)
        Make a waveform image from the input audio date.
        Parameters:
        audio - the audio amplitude data normalized to [-1.0, 1.0]
        leftmostSample - where in the audio data should we start
        rightmostSample - where in the audio will we end
        width - the width of the image in pixels
        height - the height of the image in pixels
        Returns:
        the waveform image or null

      • exportConstantQTransformSpectrogram

        public java.util.ArrayList<com.tagtraum.jipes.audio.LogFrequencySpectrum> exportConstantQTransformSpectrogram(com.tagtraum.jipes.math.WindowFunction windowFunction,
                                                                                                              int hopSize,
                                                                                                              float minFrequency,
                                                                                                              float maxFrequency,
                                                                                                              int binsPerSemitone)
                                                                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        This computes a Contant Q Transform spectrogram and returns it as array of CQT slices.
        Parameters:

        hopSize -
        minFrequency -
        maxFrequency -
        binsPerSemitone -
        Returns:

      • exportConstantQTransformSpectrogram

        public java.util.ArrayList<com.tagtraum.jipes.audio.LogFrequencySpectrum> exportConstantQTransformSpectrogram(com.tagtraum.jipes.math.WindowFunction windowFunction,
                                                                                                              int hopSize,
                                                                                                              float minFrequency,
                                                                                                              float maxFrequency,
                                                                                                              int binsPerSemitone,
                                                                                                              com.tagtraum.jipes.SignalPump<com.tagtraum.jipes.audio.AudioBuffer> pump)
                                                                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        This computes a Contant Q Transform spectrogram and returns it as array of CQT slices.
        Parameters:
        windowFunction -
        hopSize -
        minFrequency -
        maxFrequency -
        binsPerSemitone -
        pump - In other dsp frameworks the pump might be called dispatcher, it delivers the audio frames. The application can provide its own pump. Via the pump the application can cancel the processing which is useful in multithreaded environments.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • convertSpectrogramToImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage convertSpectrogramToImage(java.util.ArrayList<com.tagtraum.jipes.audio.LogFrequencySpectrum> spectrogram)
        A convenient helper method to convert a spectrogram (as obtained by, e.g., method exportConstantQTransformSpectrogram()) into a BufferedImage.
        Parameters:
        spectrogram -
        Returns:

      • convertSpectrogramToImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage convertSpectrogramToImage(java.util.ArrayList<com.tagtraum.jipes.audio.LogFrequencySpectrum> spectrogram,
                                                                     boolean normalize,
                                                                     float gamma,
                                                                     ColorCoding colorCoding)
        A convenient helper method to convert a spectrogram (as obtained by, e.g., method exportConstantQTransformSpectrogram()) into a BufferedImage. Input values are normalized.
        Parameters:
        spectrogram -
        normalize - set true to normalize the spectrogram values for image rendering (the spectrogram remains unaltered)
        gamma - 1.0f corresponds to the normalized input values with no gamma changes
        colorCoding - class ColorCoding offers some constants for easy instantiation, e.g. new ColorCoding(ColorCoding.INFERNO)
        Returns:

      • encodePcmToMp3

        public byte[] encodePcmToMp3(byte[] pcm,
                             javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat format)
        convert PCM encoded audio to MP3 encoding
        Parameters:
        pcm - PCM data as byte array, this will be changes so be sure to call this method with a clone of the original if you want to keep the original
        format - audio format of PCM data
        Returns:
        mp3 data as byte array

      • getAudioAsMp3

        public byte[] getAudioAsMp3()
        returns audio data of this object as byte array MP3 encoded, the original data (this.getAudio() or this.audio) stay unaltered
        Returns:
        byte array of MP3 encoded audio data
